channel.title: Dropmeister - Auxy Series Coming Soon
channel.description:
Hey everyone. My name is Dropmeister, and after more than a year of working hard to become a better musician, I thought that I would like to help people just starting out with Auxy getting better quickly. In the coming weeks, I'll be launching a YouTube channel packed with all sorts of Auxy content, including a unique series I hope you'll all enjoy and learn from.
I'd like to consult the community on a few things. 1. What length would you look for in tutorial/songwriting videos? Would you rather see long tutorials that cover everything or short tutorials that cover only a few things? 2. How much talking would you guys think is needed to pull you through a twenty-five-minute video of me making music? Would it be best for me to use time-lapses in some parts of the process in such a video? 3. What are your favorite genres you'd like to see an Auxy user make?
Thanks in advance, DM

item.title: Dropmeister - Auxy Series Coming Soon
item.dc:creator: Little_Baby
item.description:
No problem! (Just saying, writing a script may seem cringy, but when I record, it helps a ton)

Read full topic

item.title: Dropmeister - Auxy Series Coming Soon
item.dc:creator: Dropmeister
item.description:
The recording is done at the same time as I make the song as it’s a lot easier to know what to say that way imo. As of now I don’t need editing help, but I may later if I want to do more complex things.

Read full topic

item.title: Dropmeister - Auxy Series Coming Soon
item.dc:creator: Little_Baby
item.description:
Dropmeister:

@Little_Baby Thank you for the offer. I’ll let you know if I need any help. Do you think time lapses should be included?

You can record yourself making the song, send me the footage, and then add commentary over it, so I slow it down at parts where you need to go in depth, speed it up while you ramble or are just making wub wubs, and anything in between.

Read full topic

item.title: Dropmeister - Auxy Series Coming Soon
item.dc:creator: Mr_Mooo
item.description:
Time lapses only for the time consuming and boring parts (if there are any).
Probably future bass or house so people can learn if they dont know how (like me )

Read full topic

item.title: Dropmeister - Auxy Series Coming Soon
item.dc:creator: Dropmeister
item.description:
@Little_Baby Thank you for the offer. I’ll let you know if I need any help. Do you think time lapses should be included?

@BlaMeese I’ll do some tips and tricks for 200 BPM if that would be useful.

@TXA I have a SoundCloud but won’t be posting on it until the series starts. You can find me in Auxy’s “following”.

@Mr_Mooo To clarify, are you saying it would be better to make Electronic and Chill tutorials than Future Bass and House? Also, do you think I should use time lapses?

Read full topic

item.title: Dropmeister - Auxy Series Coming Soon
item.dc:creator: Mr_Mooo
item.description:
1. Around 25 - 30 minutes.
  2. About half of it.
  3. Electronic / Chill are the easy ones that are good for beginners. Future bass or house are harder, so I’d like I genre that lots of people don’t really know how to do.

Read full topic

item.title: Dropmeister - Auxy Series Coming Soon
item.dc:creator: TXA
item.description:
Hey @Dropmeister do you have a SoundCloud? We could listen to your tracks there if you have one.

Read full topic

item.title: Dropmeister - Auxy Series Coming Soon
item.dc:creator: BlaMeese
item.description:
I make some of my own videos on song writing by I would like to see videos on faster tempo, more layered songs. Thanks!

Read full topic

item.title: Dropmeister - Auxy Series Coming Soon
item.dc:creator: Little_Baby
item.description:
1. 20-35 minutes
  2. Prob about 40% of the video
  3. Any!

I can be your editor if you want, I also make logos, designs, and just about anything you need graphics wise.

Thanks! - Little Baby

Read full topic

item.title: Dropmeister - Auxy Series Coming Soon
item.dc:creator: Dropmeister
item.description:
Hey everyone. My name is Dropmeister, and after more than a year of working hard to become a better musician, I thought that I would like to help people just starting out with Auxy getting better quickly. In the coming weeks, I’ll be launching a YouTube channel packed with all sorts of Auxy content, including a unique series I hope you’ll all enjoy and learn from.

I’d like to consult the community on a few things.

  1. What length would you look for in tutorial/songwriting videos? Would you rather see long tutorials that cover everything or short tutorials that cover only a few things?
  2. How much talking would you guys think is needed to pull you through a twenty-five-minute video of me making music? Would it be best for me to use time-lapses in some parts of the process in such a video?
  3. What are your favorite genres you’d like to see an Auxy user make?

Thanks in advance,
DM
